content:
Grilled chicken would be an excellent addition to your dish! The smoky flavor of the grilled chicken will complement the warm, earthy flavors of the cumin-coriander pesto sauce and the sweetness of the roasted vegetables perfectly.

To make sure the chicken pairs well with the other ingredients, I'd recommend marinating it in a mixture that complements the flavors of the pesto sauce. Here's a suggestion:

**Cumin-Coriander Chicken Marinade**

Ingredients:

* 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs
* 1/4 cup plain yogurt
* 2 tablespoons lemon juice
* 1 tablespoon olive oil
* 1 teaspoon ground cumin
* 1 teaspoon ground coriander
* 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder (optional)
* Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:

1. In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, coriander, garam masala (if using), salt, and pepper.
2. Add the chicken to the marinade and mix well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
3. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off.
4. Grill the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
5. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing it thinly.

Once the chicken is cooked, slice it and add it to your dish along with the roasted vegetables and cumin-coriander pesto sauce. The combination of flavors and textures will be amazing!

Some tips to keep in mind:

* Make sure to adjust the amount of cumin and coriander in the marinade according to your personal taste preferences.
* If you prefer a stronger Indian flavor, you can add more garam masala powder to the marinade.
* Don't overcook the chicken, as it can become dry and tough. Aim for a nice char on the outside and a juicy interior.

I hope this helps, and I'm excited to hear how your dish turns out!
